today as markets concluded stock market s collapse precluded central bank carrying out widely rumoured discount rate increase senior government economist suggested both U S Japan needed to ease monetary policy now to prevent further drop New York Tokyo stock prices They need to support stock security markets he But Bank Japan officials they saw no need to change policy moment although one admitted central bank may to rethink strategy if Tokyo stock prices continue to plunge during rest week Both government Bank Japan economists agreed economy better placed now to cope deflationary impact plunging stock prices than few months ago economy recovering strongly steep drop stock prices likely to put major dent consumer business confidence one government economist There be some impact on real economy but won t be big another Individuals heavily invested stocks on their own although they do participate through trust funds other investment vehicles while many manufacturing firms turned to financial market investments profits during year s economic downturn recent rebound allowed them to refocus their attention on their core businesses he Paradoxically pick up economy partly to blame stock market collapse as companies shifted funds away financial investments to increase inventories step up capital spending one government economist deciding what response to make to steep text.body: President Corazon Aquino economic growth took priority over debt repayments but she sought to dispel fears Philippines honour July agreement rescheduling billion dlrs debt speech to major business groups Aquino Our policy been very clear fm start growth must take priority plain simple reason if we no money to pay we can t if we starve nation essential services there may be no one around to honour debt Aquino her officials try to get all creditor banks to sign debt rescheduling pact by November effective date That should end speculation remove at least one excuse hoarding dollars Aquino Violent fluctuations peso s exchange rate end month bull run local stock markets triggered dollar hoarding Aquino country s foreign debt rose to nearly billion dlrs April growing even without fresh borrowing Debt servicing took up pct budget pct export earnings Aquino Over next six years Philippines be paying creditors billion dlrs while getting only four billion dlrs new loans Aquino acknowledged there were grave doubts her government s ambitious privatisation program There always excuse government to sell she but she added I want government to get out business She non performing assets be sold open bidding Filipinos foreigners compete on equal terms

text.title: EAST WEST APPROVE NUCLEAR FUSION ENERGY PROJECT
text.body: East West on Monday decided to go ahead ambitious nuclear fusion project billed as possibly providing inexhaustible source energy International Atomic Energy Agency IAEA Representatives U S Soviet Union European Community Japan agreed to develop plans revolutionary thermonuclear reactor to produce energy splitting atoms as today s nuclear plants but by joining them Work due to begin next year at Institute Plasma Physics at Max Planck Foundation near Munich West Germany scheduled completion by IAEA statement Research into fusion s scientific feasibility been under way many years but project approved on Monday known as International Thremonuclear Experimental Reactor ITER study if actual plant could be built project represents unprecedented display East West scientific cooperation but decision be made until completion on whether actual reactor be jointly constructed or by individual participant countries Dieter Sigmar leading U S Fusion researcher month development demonstration plant cost several billion dlrs need at least another years Fusion plants produce little radioactive waste While today s nuclear power plants need uranium mined only few countries producing dangerous waste fusion plants eventually run only on deuterium element related to hydrogen available almost limitless supplies sea water according to experts

reuters.unknown: RM f reute u f BC TAKESHITA FACES TOUGH

text.title: TAKESHITA FACES TOUGH ECONOMIC MANAGEMENT JOB
text.author: By Tsukasa Maekawa
text.body: Former Finance Minister Noboru Takeshita chosen on Monday to be Japan s next prime minister face tough test managing Japan s economy very start his two year term economists businessmen Takeshita told news conference on Tuesday he do his best to continue domestic reforms external policies Prime Minister Yasuhiro Nakasone However leading Japanese businessmen called on Takeshita to outdo Nakasone by showing stronger leadership Takeshita should merely follow Nakasone policies but should cope mounting economic issues new vision policies Takashi Ishihara chairman Japan Committee Economic Development statement Economists generally agreed there be no major changes Japan s economic policies under new leader However expectations high among major industries new initiatives by Takeshita immediate effective measures to solve economic problems such as trade friction U S Administrative tax reforms soaring land prices Eishiro Saito chairman Federation Economic Organisations Keidanren urged Takeshita to succeed unifying ruling Liberal Democratic Party as soon as possible to tackle difficult tasks Regarding foreign economic polices Yoshitoki Chino chairman Japan Securities Dealers Association Takeshita should come up economic measures well before economic issues develop into problems Behind those calls on Takeshita prompt action doubts his capability handling international issues due to his lack experience diplomacy economists Economists foreign countries should be patient Takeshita who widely known as ultra cautious politician Takeshita repeatedly There should be consensus before taking action Takeshita so far failed to unveil specific measures to reduce Japan s huge trade surplus economists He Japan continue to stimulate economy to open market wider to foreign products

reuters.unknown: RM f reute u f BC JAPANESE STOCK PLUNGE

text.title: JAPANESE STOCK PLUNGE RAISES FUNDING PROBLEMS
text.author: By James Kynge
text.body: The massive plunge Tokyo stock prices on Tuesday could rob Government much needed revenue to spur Japan s economy may hurt banks ability to lend abroad analysts polled by Reuters The Japanese Government depending on sale NTT Nippon Telegraph Telephone Corp NCCT T shares much public spending budget Shigeo Suzuki deputy general manager at Industrial Bank Japan Japan hoped to raise at least billion yen sale NTT shares on November However pct plunge Tokyo share index today made such plans look unrealistic analysts The government could defer sale NTT or they could offer fewer shares Keikichi Honda general manager economic research at Bank Tokyo Ltd Honda another possibility underwriters handling NTT sale to pay Government amount expected to get bear brunt any losses themselves That what underwriting means he added Finance Ministry official confirmed government planned to go ahead sale NTT shares on November Another possible effect Tokyo s stock tumble be to seriously undermine asset base Japanese banks banks lend money all over world regard market value stock holdings as assets analysts Japanese banks make loans using perhaps as much as to pct market value their unrealised stock holdings as assets Industrial Bank s Suzuki There also concern Japanese companies invested heavily Tokyo s stocks as their real business declined over two years sustained heavy losses Many companies mainly export oriented companies were planning on selling their shares profit to reinvest real businesses as economy begins to pick up one analyst at foreign brokerage That prospect now looks dim But analysts unlikely companies or financial institutions be bankrupted by losses stock trading I don t think any company so badly exposed stock investments senior analyst at Nomura Research Institute In terms financial institutions luckily rebounding bond market currency markets still profitable he added Nomura analyst pct decline Tokyo stocks be translated into fall pct consumer spending Some pct Tokyo stocks owned by individuals Market capitalisation on Tokyo Stock Exchange fell to billion yen on Tuesday billion at Monday s close NTT shares ended yen lower at each well down their peak April

reuters.unknown: Y f reute u f BC INDONESIA SAYS IT WIL

text.title: INDONESIA SAYS IT WILL EXTEND OIL CONTRACTS
text.body: Indonesia told oil industry on Tuesday extend contracts on producing blocks improve investment climate but wants to see increased expenditure on exploration return President Suharto opening speech to Indonesian Petroleum Association Indonesia ready to extend contracts held by foreign oil companies on producing areas In order to boost investment petroleum industry government Indonesia basically approved extending production sharing contracts under present laws Suharto Apart government keep improving investment climate order to accelerate development petroleum industry he Indonesian Energy Minister Subroto told Association he aware oil industry needed to be assured contracts on blocks expiring within next years be renewed before they invest further exploration As we all heard morning President fully aware situation Subroto The government already made political decision to entertain time problem by inviting existing producers to continue their activities Indonesia albeit on selective basis Indonesia one members OPEC must find new oil reserves if to remain exporter next decade oil industry sources say Subroto government also working to ease other problems including granting easier terms remote areas or deep water conditions But Subroto relations oil companies were two way they should step up expenditure on oil exploration now oil price recovered President Suharto he wanted to see greater transfer technology to Indonesian companies more help oil industry regions companies operated Abdul Rachman Ramly President state oil company Pertamina budgeted exploration production expenditure all oil companies Indonesia forecast to fall to billion dlrs calendar billion Pertamina production sharing or joint operation contracts foreign oil companies Subroto speeding up necessary approvals field operations government priority There been misunderstandings between government oil industry certain areas such as when field designated commercial thorough evaluation being made He government wanted to finalise contract extensions as soon as practical urged industry meantime to maintain exploration drive Subroto Indonesia needed companies to maintain exploration efforts even if their contract due to expire within years This need itself some sort guarantee we soon to come up extension agreement Eleven major contract areas due to come up renewal between industry sources Extension contracts on blocks involved detailed negotiations but so far no extension been granted Subroto told reporters afterwards contract extensions be selective based on how much capital be invested

text.title: U S COFFEE IMPORT REPORTING SYSTEM QUESTIONED
text.author: BY Susan Zeidler
text.body: A voluntary compliance system monitoring U S coffee imports under quotas viewed skeptically by many coffee industry analysts trade sources Many sectors trade including large roasters importers adamant against voluntary compliance because past subject to tremendous irregularities as became matter trade monitoring each other one analyst On Monday National Coffee Association newsletter Office U S Trade Representative implement voluntary compliance system temporarily because legislation to monitor imports tied up Congressional trade bill Under arrangement milar to one coffee importers voluntarily present needed documents to U S government until Congress approves monitoring authority but if coffee arrives without valid certification still be allowed entry While many believe producers seek to add to overburdened stock situation U S others believe some ship outside quota requirements lieu monitoring controls trade sources Last time there lot false information submitted to customs resulted lot indictments fines U S Customs spokesman Customs can do good job when given tools but when hands tied doesn t authority to demand Form O documents tracking merchandise source to destination he Many see as true test whether producers importers abide by quota system It key to seeing whether there any teeth quota agreement one major U S roaster Last time we gentleman s agreement trade did act as gentleman another analyst adding without need to submit documents ball be producers hands Some feel importers take advantage voluntary compliance due to development two tier market non member countries buy coffee at big discount Many fear dealers buy coffee destined non member countries at discounts then bring into U S falsely labelled According to customs officials several green coffee importers confessed they imported coffee fraudulently after buying non member destinations forging landing certificates then relabelling as navy beans If there s much discrepancy between prices one country another producers may be teted to get rid their stocks coffee by selling to non member nations by circumventing quota provisions Paine Webber analyst Bernie Savaiko Still others believe producers be hard pressed to aggravate overburdened coffee stock situation U S near term It be naive to suggest any agreement some share connivance but I think voluntary system seemed to suffice coupled fact we so much coffee I don t think poses much threat one trader

reuters.unknown: C G f reute b f BC NO PRESSING NEED FOR

text.title: NO PRESSING NEED FOR SOVIET WHEAT SUBSIDY LYNG
text.body: The Soviets indicated urgent need U S wheat subsidy offer unlikely such offer be ma during U S Soviet summit expected to be held next month Agriculture Secretary Richard Lyng told Reuters exclusive interview Reuters Lyng he did know if United States offer Moscow another wheat subsidy offer year or when offer be made Last year well into year before we offered There s been nothing s taken place to indicate to me there s pressing need on their part sort deal a wheat subsidy When asked if subsidy be offered at U S Soviet summit Lyng No I don t think so I don t think Agriculture Secretary U S wheat subsidy deal to Moscow be kind topic appropriate discussion at summit It be kind issue President or Chairman get into specific negotiations or discussions Lyng When Mr Nikonov communist party secretary agriculture here he indicated trade wheat something be discussed President United States He s presidential Lyng Lyng uncertainties wheat quality some major producing areas world volatile wheat prices still unfinished Soviet grain harvest could delay any final decision on timing another wheat subsidy to Moscow future U S Soviet long term grains agreement be discussed first next year Lyng but Agriculture Secretary questioned benefits long standing agreement We ve three years row Soviets failed to live up to their end agreement We love to continue to keep doing busines Soviet Union but do we need long term agreement Who benefits These some questions we need to discuss When asked if he felt United States benefitted agreement Lyng I don t know certainly hasn t been what we hoped be three years running they ve Moscow failed to live up to what we considered agreement

reuters.unknown: C G f reute b f BC LYNG SAYS INDIA FOOD

text.title: LYNG SAYS INDIA FOOD AID PACKAGE NOT READY
text.body: The United States India yet agreed on food aid package to help drought stricken Asian country Agriculture Secretary Richard Lyng Lyng told Reuters interview two countries been discussing package but he did expect specifics offer to be announced during Indian Prime Minister Rajiv Gandhi s visit here week We been talking potential needs India might both their commercial market purchases needs as well as possibilities assistance Lyng At point there no detailed plan or program amounts what commodities uncertain But we indicated to Indians we stand ready to assist whatever way they deem most valuable he There been speculation trade circles USDA offer India subsidized vegetable oil under export enhancement program donate surplus corn under Section amended law Lyng indicated two countries been unable to agree on mix concessional commercial aid Washington prefer package include something other than donated food The Indians capable purchasing lot taking care themselves India country come long way ability to produce food they great pride Lyng We the United States obviously surpluses we still many commodities like to share import business Indians do then we some as we always do compassion people India like to cooperate them he Lyng he no plans to meet Indian officials during Gandhi s visit here adding I just don t know anything might be announced specifically Asked if the ball Indians court he Yes Gandhi to leave Washington Tuesday evening

reuters.text: SHULTZ SAYS U S ECONOMY IS STRONG LONDON Oct U S Secretary of State George Shultz after discussing Monday s record selling spree on the world s stock markets with British Foreign Secretary Sir Geoffrey Howe said the American economy is in very strong shape Shultz a former economics professor and former Treasury Secretary said the underlying fact If you look at the U S Economy is that we continue to have a very strong economic performance He cited as positive factors declining U S Unemployment and low inflation Shultz said he did not know to what extent the stock selling frenzy reflected concerns about U S Trade and budget deficits REUTER

reuters.unknown: A f reute d f BC LOUVRE REAFFIRMATION

text.title: LOUVRE REAFFIRMATION NOT ENOUGH U K ANALYSTS
text.author: By Rowena Whelan
text.body: U S West German reaffirmation support Louvre Accord cannot cure fundamental problems bedevilling world economy lie behind current collapse stock markets London economists There s going to to be some acknowledgement dollar going to be allowed to slip Richard Jeffrey Hoare Govett If there going to be continued fear when pressure emerges on dollar Fed be forced to tighten throws up economic abyss recession U S obvious knock on effects on rest world But some economists added Wall Street s crash dragged other major markets down may help curb very problems sparked turmoil namely world inflation fears massive persistent U S Trade deficits If there benefit pct fall Wall Street It s some sort resistance to inflation worldwide Geoffrey Dennis brokers James Capel echoing comments other London Tokyo analysts Lower personal wealth lower stock prices fears further falls should dampen credit growth curbing inflationary pressures import demand U S They say Such considerations may be helping bond markets resist equity crash according to Mike Osborne Kleinwort Grieveson It be suicidal any government context what happened couple days to jack up their interest rates he added Stocks surged after news Chemical Bank cut prime lending rate half point to pct Tuesday U S Fed chairman Alan Greenspan pledged support financial system news eroded most immediate fears stock collapse spill over into economy via banking crisis example thus precipitating recession also helped dollar rally sharply to high marks European low But economists today s whiplash moves do long term significance markets should try to keep underlying fundamentals mind The United States been able to live on borrowed time If effect crash to produce slower economic growth recession It contains good news and provides more realistic assessment U S Economy Capel s Dennis But he added markets still very much danger The liquidity doesn t disappear All s doing disappearing equity markets Dennis noted David Morrison Goldman Sachs International world market turbulence be exacerbated if Group Seven G leading western nations confirms base dollar as implied by West German Finance Minister Gerhard Stoltenberg s remarks intervention to support currencies still on week s dollar fall partly triggered by expectations Germans were more worried money supply impact such intervention than maintaining currency stability But rigid adherence to dollar ranges be bad Morrison The Louvre Accord fundamentally misconceived To stabilise dollar at too high level wrong he

text.title: U K CREDIT POLICY SEEN STEADY DESPITE BANK DATA
text.author: By Sandy Critchley
text.body: An unexpectedly heavy billion stg surge U K September sterling bank lending unlikely to nudge Bank England towards tightening monetary policy as long as sterling remains present robust state economists acute crisis confidence equity markets over past two days any case subdue personal consumer credit demand largely been behind growth lending In normal course events markets been extremely worried figure noted Peter Spencer U K Economist Credit Suisse First Boston After initial dip reaction to bank lending data compared won stg August rise U K Government bonds gilts soared as investors continued to flee plummetting equities into relative security government securities Equity markets dropped sharply on news touching day s low on FTSE index after data before staging recovery Sterling held buoyant tone throughout U K Money market rates similarly calm response resumed slightly easier trend earlier morning after little more than token blip as figures came out Noting such huge rise credit extended by banks under other circumstances prompted market fears rise clearing bank base rates current pct With financial markets doing what they re doing s thing Bank England want to do Spencer The monetary situation clearly very bad but as long as sterling firm authorities unlikely to put rates up Kevin Boakes chief U K Economist at Greenwell Montagu Gilt Edged Boakes pointed to rise narrow money measure M to pct year on year August s pct growth he must cause some concern at Treasury But The fact overall broad money growth slowed down rather encouraging sign noted Paul Temperton U K Economist Merrill Lynch Capital Markets He pointed to fall year on year growth rate M broad money aggregate to pct September August s pct concern credit growth prompted Bank England to engineer one point rise U K Bank base rates to pct early August caution endorsed subsequently by news massive billion stg July rise bank lending Temperton noted particular focus bank worry period been behaviour U K Asset markets Housing equities were key two asset markets influencing consumer behaviour he light precipitous falls on U K Equity markets past few days There almost certainly be straightforward impact on consumer spending on retail sales Temperton Almost certainly we can look forward to slower growth consumer borrowing if equity shakeout continues he added I think stock market decided bank lending figure thing past We talking very serious panic flight to quality Spencer U K Treasury official important to look at all monetary information just bank lending adding monetary aggregates were growing much more slowly than bank lending Senior banking sources noted surge bank lending evidence continuing recent trend fairly heavy personal sector borrowing Figures Banking Information Service showed personal sector lending by U K Clearing banks rose by billion stg September after stg August rise Much rise reflected quarterly interest payments

reuters.unknown: C G T f reute r f BC U S TAKES TOUGH STAN

text.title: U S TAKES TOUGH STAND ON GATT FARM ISSUES
text.author: By Lisa Vaughan
text.body: The United States prepared to pull out all stops to defend agricultural trade rights under General Agreement on Tariffs Trade GATT U S Ambassador to GATT Michael Samuels Those rights now being challenged by European Community s EC agricultural support policies he told conference sponsored by American Soybean Association He reiterated Washington s firm intention to retaliate if EC goes ahead bans imports hormone fed beef without issue being investigated by GATT special committee U S claims EC directive due to come into effect on January threatens to cut dlrs worth U S meat shipments into EC U S also oppose all EC efforts to impair U S trade via EC oilseeds regime supports EC oilseed prices over current market level may be extended to include hotly disputed oils fats tax Samuels Reduction trade distorting world agricultural subsidies aim most key participants GATT multilateral trade negotiations is meaningless if import barriers continue to be erected Samuels Samuels called U S plan to eliminate world farm subsidies by year proposed at GATT July visionary very serious EC Japan unrealistic EC Commission month announced draft proposal on farm trade reform expected to be tabled at GATT formally next week EC scheme involves emergency measures to reduce tensions troubled surplus sectors cereals cereals substitutes dairy sugar also calls reduction farm subsidies U S opposed to short term measures as long as they directly linked to long term commitments to end major trade distortions Samuels Washington review EC proposal when formally submitted respond to officially then We consider relation to Punta del Este declaration to correct trade problems expand market access U S Ambassador U S can say no to EC proposal if EC ignores U S plan when tables own proposal he added key difference between two approaches U S wants farm subsidies eliminated while EC pushing only reduction farm suppports Samuels If EC farm budget were protected by subsidy freeze there be little incentive Community to work to correct international trade situation he added Samuels cited animal hormones complaint EC oilseeds regime EC regulation concerning meat imports to third countries as three crucial barriers to trade U S wants to see resolved under auspices GATT

reuters.unknown: RM f reute u f BC BAKER SEEN WINNING GE

text.title: BAKER SEEN WINNING GERMAN INTEREST RATES BATTLE
text.author: By Felix Dearden
text.body: The United States appears to won transatlantic battle by forcing Bundesbank to trim interest rates European economists But they added Washington set stakes high by testing limits Louvre accord while global stock markets were plunging West German Finance Minister Gerhard Stoltenberg U S Treasury Secretary James Baker reaffirmed their commitment to currency stability at secret meeting yesterday Frankfurt according to official statements released late Monday Only hours after statements were released Bundesbank reduced short term interest rates by offering banks liquidity at fixed bid rate pct down pct facility rate offered week While two ministers were meeting Bundesbank president Karl Otto Poehl central bank also added money market liquidity repeatedly signalling did want strong rise tender allocation rate on Tuesday It s round one to Americans Richard Reid senior European economist brokers UBS Philips Drew London But Reid added We shouldn t forget taken one biggest stock market crashes decades to get West Germans to cut their security repurchase rate by percentage point Over weekend criticism by Baker earlier tightening West German monetary policy led to sharp dollar fall fuelled speculation Louvre accord no longer valid Six leading industrial nations agreed under February s Louvre Accord to stabilise currencies coordinate monetary policies since been reaffirmed by Group Seven US Japan West Germany Britain France Italy Canada Frankfurt meeting on Monday soothed currency markets dollar gained over two pfennigs after hours trading New York At Frankfurt fixing on Tuesday dollar quoted at marks compared on Monday Guenther Aschoff chief economist at Deutsche Genossenschaftbank Frankfurt massive declines on world stock markets been main reason fall West German short term interest rates on Tuesday The Bundesbank wanted to set marker after stock market losses responsible thing to do if fits Baker s wishes then all better he No central bank wants to let interest rates rise Bundesbank been forced to put rates up following rises U S Aschoff Poehl told conference Frankfurt on Tuesday central bank no interest higher capital market rates he thought global rate increase cause concern Giles Keating economist Credit Suisse First Boston Ltd London The cautious Bundesbank beaten retreat Baker won battle But he hasn t won war as security repurchase rate still points higher than before IMF meeting month Washington Before IMF meeting when Louvre Accord reaffirmed Bundesbank offering money market liquidity at pct Keating noted Economists United States now appeared to agreed to play by rules Louvre Accord support dollar return German action on interest rates Any further sharp decline dollar hinder Washington s efforts to reduce trade deficit Stoltenberg told news conference on Tuesday He added he rule out central banks leading industrial countries intervening on exchange markets to defend dollar s value Deutsche Genossenschaftbank s Aschoff stressed West Germany s heavy dependence on exports need currency stability addition both U S West German central banks were keen to avoid dollar slide force them to again spend vast sums intervening to support dollar

text.title: STOCK TUMBLE MAY SCARE RETIREES OUT OR MARKET
text.author: By Peter Kiernan
text.body: Many Florida investors old enough to seen all before they lived through Crash Monday s stock market debacle just another day some I don t sell declared one elderly investor who he more than one dlrs stocks Whatever goes down bound to come back up uniqueness south Florida investors easy to see brokerage offices around Miami where average age crowds watching Big Board quotations flash by on Tuesday retirement beyond I don t know any demographic studies but we certainly highest number elderly active investors Marshall Moore vice president AmeriFirst Securities Corporation Miami He worries Monday s record loss more than points on New York Stock Exchange scare many people particularly those on fixed incomes out market forever They be stocks any longer he When you start getting heart palpitations sweaty palms you to get out stay out except maybe utilities some income oriented issues Across state on Gulf coast where there heavy concentrations retired persons Robert Lee Investment Management Research Incorporated there were a lot serious losses out there Retirees account per cent his firm s business could take comfort fact professional managers took their money out market month But those who were buying on recent upswing devastating he Miami Beach broker George Fox most whose clients over worries many taking situation seriously enough Those who depend on their market earnings should be lot more concerned he I am scared because I think could become very serious One year old investor market bound to fall sharply I just didn t think happen so soon She remembered she remained stingy to day as result I still find hard to spend money

reuters.unknown: F f reute d f BC MARKETS SAFEGUARDS SCHEDULED

text.title: U S SAFETY NETS SHOULD BLOCK TYPE CRASH
text.author: By Michael Posner
text.body: Cascading global stock prices evoking grim memories great market crash but analysts reminding investors safeguards place before they stash their savings under mattress But some also say while banking securities social laws written during great depression should prevent repeat dismal era more protection still might to be considered analysts caution while new laws can deal some problems lawmakers can t legislate away fear which helped drive New York Stock Exchange to record point Dow Jones index loss on Monday percent loss nearly doubled Oct loss percent On day before year market fell nearly per cent series Reuters interviews government congressional private analysts most agreed safeguards exist to avoid repeat depression aftermath Charles Schultze chairman president s Council Economic Advisers under Jimmy Carter interview the safeguards should be adequate to avoid repeat to The safeguards fine he The safeguards adequate to prevent cascading liquidity failure s overall problem dollar trade deficits Schultze now Brookings Institution think tank pointed to weak Federal Reserve during s when the Fed acted wrong way it tightened money Similarly President Reagan s budget manager James Miller told Reuters safeguards place should be adequate millionaire oilman business takeover specialist T Boone Pickens present safeguards should avoid any situation It much more sophisticated system I don t see comparison valid Marvin Kosters director economic policy studies at conservative American Enterprise Institute thinks present safeguards work The main thing understanding Federal Reserve responsibility to maintain liquidity economy he There no reason why market fall needs to spread into real economy Maybe s better happened at all Rex Hardesty huge labor confederation AFL CIO many present safeguards working saying only one third unemployed now receiving benefits He also called increase dlr minimum wage been raised since One main things appears different than market psychology analysts point out During those anything goes days flappers bathtub gin stock market road to riches captured savings shoeshine boys to bank presidents viewed as highway to heaven no turning back But happy days soon collapsed into nationwide hysterical panic stock market crash wiping out paper millions losing life savings many average investors as panic set Brokers leaped Wall Street skyscrapers American banks closed holiday as depositors clamored to pull out their savings great depression followed leading into World War II Images those days surfaced unprecedented sell off on Monday but analysts maintained times different House Banking committee specialist Jake Lewis bank investors should no fears because their savings now completely backed by government Even though there been record bank failures year year through today everyone received their savings unlike millions lost when banks collapsed years ago Banking deposits then uninsured now fully insured by government up to dlrs each saver As depression swept nation President Franklin Roosevelt steered into law sweeping banking securities reforms to deal many problems led to crash hurt people afterwards

text.body: Finance Minister Gerhard Stoltenberg he surprised by recent criticism West German economic policies voiced by U S Treasury Secretary James Baker but added criticism purely one sided Stoltenberg told West German Trade Industry Association DIHT before meeting Baker on Monday There been surprising notes criticism from United States He added Criticism one way street He did elaborate but Bonn often called on U S To reduce federal budget deficit Over weekend Baker criticised West German economic policies saying rises domestic interest rates here were spirit February s Louvre pact to stabilise currencies Stoltenberg told DIHT his meeting on Monday Baker resolved differences between two countries At news conference earlier on Tuesday Stoltenberg declined to comment specifically on Baker s criticisms but he after three hours discussions on Monday one remark or another been clarified

reuters.unknown: Y f reute u f AM GULF SILKWORM NEWS A NALYSIS

text.title: US RULED OUT ATTACK ON IRANIAN SILKWORMS
text.body: U S military planners ruled out Iran s Silkworm missiles as target retaliatory attack mounted on Monday fear being drawn more deeply into Iran Iraq war defense Middle East experts U S naval forces destroyed offshore oil platform raided another what administration called measured appropriate response to Iranian Silkworm missile attack Friday on U S flagged tanker Kuwaiti waters Private analysts generally agreed going after rig rather than onshore economic or military target such as Silkworm launch sites reflected careful bid by Washington to limit political military diplomatic fallout both at home Gulf It simply demonstrated United States take military action when they Iran take military action Norman Polmar defense analyst author He hitting platforms spared Iran embarrassment casualties on own soil possibly avoiding escalating spiral attack counterattack addition minimized risk to U S forces potential embarrassment any losses including aircraft could been shot down they taken part attack Anthony Cordesman author new book on Iran Iraq war United States apparently chose limited target to keep alive possibility U N Secretary General Javier Perez de Cuellar might still persuade Iran to accept Security Council call ceasefire We want U N peace initiative to work if there s any chance at all he adding action made clear tougher steps follow if Iran text.title: AMERICAN EXPRESS SAYS ITS STRATEGY IS STABLE
text.author: By Alison Rea
text.body: American Express Co s AXP president Louis Gerstner Jr bear market effect his company s long term strategy I don t think where market goes over any month long period two day period or even six month period anything to do our strategy Gerstner told Reuters We built strategy our company looks out over many years anticipates lot change he Gerstner company s long term strategy to build maintain major position financial travel service industries American Express pct parent Shearson Lehman Brothers Inc SHE Gerstner comment on share market tailspin However American Express chairman James Robinson statement company could endure market turbulence strong position further growth All brokerage firms make money if market goes down or up Gerstner told Reuters without elaborating Gerstner Shearson no plans to quit municipal bond activities Shearson Lehman Brothers tends to adjust to trends incremental steps You see doing less convulsive one time changes people industry go through he Shearson recently laid off people London limiting hiring but Gerstner American Express remains committed to London market to having global presence That Shearson let couple hundred people go London even anthill on landscape we re discussing We discussing long term strategy Gerstner Earlier year American Express sold pct stake Shearson to Nippon Life Insurance Co Japan further pct to public Gerstner these moves had no implications exit financial services Our committment globally represented by Nippon tie up dwarfs fact we decided to reduce size one department one company one our subsidiaries he Many securities firms now stressing merchant banking to bolster earnings hurt by bond market volatility slow retail business drop underwriting volume When asked if more players make system more risky Gerstner I can t comment on other firms but Shearson going to follow feeding frenzy direction merchant banking We going to overreach Gerstner also spoke securitization or repackaging debt as marketable securities It almost imperative to create security backed by funds flowing LDC lessor developed countries debt program going to happen but very difficult to create security current climate Gerstner Securitized products could be structured either retail or institutional markets Gerstner If you look at junk bond phenomenom started out mostly institutional buyers Primarily through mutual funds individual buyers became presense market I d guess we d see similiar situation LDC debt he The fundamental thing to happen before there can be sucessful securitization debt burden on countries to be reduced amount money coming commerical banks future call money on commercial banks to be reduced Gerstner

text.body: The Bank New York Corp BK reaffirmed terms offer Irving Bank Corp despite drop Bank New York s share price to Bank New York spokesman The offer still stands we changed our offer Bank New York spokesman Irving comment on how drop market affects position on bid or whether buy back any own shares Earlier month Irving rejected bid as inadequate wanted to retain independence late September Bank New York offered dlrs per share cash pct Irving remaining pct offered exchange shares shares one Irving share At time stock purchase portion worth close to dlrs per share but now portion worth dlrs per share net price dlrs one analyst According to prospectus offer shareholders may tender all cash or all shares on first come first serve basis Analysts were mixed how stock price drop affect acquisition If gets to Irving shareholders they approve but Irving hopes offer won t go to shareholders Mark Alpert banking analyst Bear Stearns Cos Inc And market saying deal won t go through Alpert The transaction looks highly unlikely to be completed at present If Irving wouldn t go offer at dlrs share then they won t go at lower price another analyst analyst also doubted Bank New York could afford to retain original offer However industry sources were more uncertain prospects deal With Irving s price so low Bank New York s offer look good to Irving shareholders Michael Flores consultant at Bank Earnings International consulting firm drop Irving s share to dlrs per share dlr drop beginning week increases chance Bank New York succeed Flores Analysts drop bank stock prices likely to depress level mergers acquisition banking industry Bank takeovers less likely because banks can t use their own stock to make acquisitions because their share price too depressed Alpert Since only banks can buy another bank only other possible acquirors be foreign bank Alpert In market drop stock acquirors got clobbered more than acquirees another analyst

reuters.unknown: C G T f reute u f AM COMMUNITY AGRICULTURE

text.title: EC FARM MINISTERS BACK SPENDING CURBS IDEA
text.body: European Community EC agriculture ministers gave their support principle new scheme to limit spending on bloc s controversial farm policy at meeting Luxembourg on Tuesday Danish minister Laurits Tornaes told journalists Acceptance scheme by farmers suffer price cuts if their production exceeded certain norms known EC jargon as stabilisers seen by diplomats as vital if EC to solve current massive budget crisis Speaking at news conference after chairing two day meeting farm ministers Tornaes It no longer question whether we to stabilisers now question how we to implement them However EC sources warned despite Tornaes optimism may be difficult to get sort detailed agreement needed on stabiliser scheme ahead EC heads government meeting Copenhagen on December vital meeting at EC leaders be asked to agree new system EC financing ending bloc s hand to mouth existence resulted being unable to agree budget Britain block moves to give EC additional sources finance unless detailed system stabilisers agreed at or ahead summit Under most important stabiliser scheme EC guaranteed prices cereals be cut by one percentage point every per cent by annual harvest exceeded tonnes figure well below what EC farmers capable producing year favourable weather conditions Farm ministers meet again on November to attempt to hammer out accord Danish diplomatic sources meeting could through several long nights negotiation But Tornaes any thought success ultimately possible be gesture retreat at stage EC Commission sources among remaining problems were appeals Southern member states protection their small relatively poor farmers calls France Netherlands significant changes to Commission proposals arable crops They added West Germany appears still reluctant to accept idea production ceilings being set at level EC as whole rather than member states Meanwhile ministers made little progress agreeing scheme to top up income poorer farmers through direct payments could help to cushion impact stabilisers on them British minister John MacGregor told journalists The proposals as they stand very few friends He number countries fear they could simply encourage further unwanted production by giving farmers cash to improve production methods

reuters.unknown: RM A f reute r f BC MARKETS BAKER SCHEDULED NEWS ANALYSIS

text.title: TREASURY S BAKER UNDER FIRE FOR WALL STREET DROP
text.author: By Alver Carlson
text.body: As official Washington sought to restore investor confidence after Monday s Wall Street collapse Treasury Secretary James Baker came under fire critics who claimed he helped to precipitate crisis Baker s weekend blast at West German Bundesbank boosting interest rates seemed to signal unraveling international accord to stabilize currency values Nigel Lawson British Chancellor Exchequer among those who treasury secretary s statements helped spur wave stock sales by making already jittery investors think clash between two major economic powers damage world economy Lawson told London television interviewer Tuesday I think scale stock fall very great I think partly due to statements been made by senior figures on other side Atlantic dispute should never happened he added Although Baker appeared to patch over rift at hastily called meeting West German officials Monday he still faced storm criticism on his return to United States on Tuesday Baker cut short long planned trip to Scandinavia to return here to deal economic crisis one U S analyst Baker s weekend remarks His timing could been worse One government bond salesman New York He actually thought yelling at Germans threatening to smack dollar down work doesn t show much understanding international monetary gamesmanship However some analysts West Germany s stubborn march toward higher interest rates may forced Baker s hand On surface Baker may look responsible but if you go back to see what caused unsettling financial markets West German policy Robert Brusca Nikko Securities International New York All Mr Baker did to mention obvious public so making him responsible little like killing messenger he After Monday s talks U S West German governments made clear Louvre currency accord pieced together Paris February still effect Wall Street feared collapse agreement might be prelude to hyper inflation economic malaise similar to late s Analysts believe Monday s Wall Street crash wiped out billion dlrs stock values Treasury sources Baker already unhappy Bonn s refusal to stimulate economy order to keep global recovery moving angered by Bundesbank interest rate boost seemed destined to do just opposite He felt U S recovery inching along th month could no longer be only engine global economic expansion growing U S economy been serving as huge market debtor country exports Moreover Baker consummate politician worried Republican party might face next year s presidential election main showpiece vibrant economy badly tarnished rise global interest rates might worsen debt crisis completely choke off U S economic growth already slowed to tepid pct annual rate There s no doubt can adverse effect on economy s important psychology turn around quickly or else obviously panic feed on itself eventually there ll be serious price to pay economically former deputy Treasury Secretary Richard Darman television interview many ways official response mild Washington stunned by sudden Wall Street retreat President Reagan speaking most people by admitting he puzzled U S government sources secretary immediately returned to Treasury to be briefed on market developments presumably their political impact all seems unlikely Baker s status Washington diminish because market fall Asked by reporters if somebody s head should roll because Wall Street retreat Texas Democratic Senator Lloyd Bentsen some irony Oh I think s much too late to be doing You administration s taken attitude we can put country on automatic pilot retire to living room to take nap You just can t do

text.title: REAGAN SAYS HE IS WILLING TO NEGOTIATE ON BUDGET
text.body: President Reagan he ordered administration to begin talks congressional leaders on budget deficit reduction plan Reagan statement following meeting his top economic advisers he prepared to order across board spending cuts to comply Federal balanced budget law but preferred to negotiate Congress He he consider anything congressional leadership proposed but spokesman he remains opposed to raising taxes as way to reduce deficit I think preferable if possible executive legislative branches reach budget deficit reduction package Accordingly I am directing discussions be undertaken bipartisan leadership Congress purpose Reagan Asked whether he consider raising taxes Reagan I am willing to look at whatever proposal they might As Reagan boarded helicopter to visit his wife Nancy at Bethesda Naval Hospital he questioned as to whether meant he softening on his tax stance Reagan replied if you heard must been helicopter White House spokesman Marlin Fitzwater later told reporters Reagan changing his opposition to tax increases Fitzwater administration accept automatic cuts under Gramm Rudman balanced budget law rather than raise taxes Earlier on Tuesday congressional leaders called economic summit White House to address nation s budget trade deficits some analysts say were partly to blame stock market drop Reagan he be willing to participate personally any negotiations Congress White House earlier seemed to reject idea negotiating Congress on budget deficit Fitzwater morning White House continued to oppose budget summit Congress on grounds be used by Democrats as platform to press tax increase But Reagan announced his willingness to negotiate Congress after meeting hour White House Chief Staff Howard Baker Treasury Secretary James Baker Federal Reserve Board Chairman Alan Greenspan chief economic adviser Beryl Sprinkel

reuters.unknown: F f reute u f BC COMPUTER SYSTEMS STRA

text.title: COMPUTER SYSTEMS STRAINED BY MARKET COLLAPSE
text.author: By Lawrence Edelman
text.body: The nation s exchanges brokerage houses their computers systems been strained by avalanche trading triggered by past week s stock market collapse while financial instry s hi tech resources been able to handle crisis sudden surge trading volume likely force exchanges securities firms to revamp their computer systems communications networks several years earlier than they planned industry officials We already started certain processes to increase New York Stock Exchange s capacity Jim Squyres spokesman Securities Industry Automation Corp runs central computer network New York American Stock Exchanges We to seriously consider speeding up he After three straight days record volume however many exchanges were pushing their systems to untested limits while exchanges their computers were handling crush brokers traders complained lost trades delayed price quotes most serious problems arose on Monday when record fall points dow volume more than shares on New york stock exchange stunned entire industry American Stock Exchange s order routing system crashed just minutes before trading closed Pacific Stock Exchange suspended business half hour early so could catch up massive backlog trades price quote feed supplied by NYSE cut off several times during day leaving some traders quotes were often minutes behind actual market Although computers whirred away late into night exchanges opened on time Tuesday problems were fewer even though NYSE volume swelled to shares Combined volume NYSE American over the counter exchanges topped shares I think we re equipped kind trading Paul Stevens executive vice president operations American Stock Exchange The problem less computers handling volume than strain on people he The computers might turn out to be heroes whole thing added DuWayne Peterson executive vice president technology at Merrill Lynch Co Inc fact officials biggest constraint on trading caused by some oldest machines on exchange floors card printers issue buy sell orders But even as computer executives spoke awe their systems ability to hold up under unprecedented pressure they started to plan future We to do lot innovative things to handle volume Squyres Securities Industry Automation Corp SIAC jointly owned by New York American Stock exchanges SIAC planned to boost capacity system by up to pct by But other improvements now be made much earlier Meanwhile New York Telephone Co Monday s panic selling did wreak havoc on telephone system It normally heavy business day company spokesman Steve Marcus

text.title: STOCK MARKET S FALL MAY BE BAD OMEN FOR REPUBLICANS
text.author: By MICHAEL GELB
text.body: Monday s stock market collapse could spell disaster Republican hopes retaining White House if proves to be start general economic downturn political experts The question does stock market decline signal impending recession If case Republicans very difficult time winning independent political analyst William Schneider told Reuters If Democrats nominate anyone halfway credible they win he added Schneider s comments on heels point decline bellwheter Dow Jones stock market average reflected old political adage elections almost always decided by voters feelings their financial well being There no doubt people always vote their pocketbook we don t expect to be any different says Donald Foley top spokesman Missouri Representative Richard Gephardt s Democratic presidential campaign Foley added five year old stock market rally shown amazing resilience there s no telling where market be by end week President Reagan he puzzled by day s events but convinced economy fundamentally sound I think everyone puzzled because all business indices up There nothing wrong economy he told reporters I don t think anyone should panic because all economic indicators solid he added But time being decline on Wall Street knocked underpinnings his boasts record bull market demonstrates wisdom current economic policy could also deprive Republicans major argument keeping White House their hands when President Reagan leaves office January gives hollow ring to words used by Vice President George Bush just week ago when he formally entered White House race We weathered storm Our economy recovered to be strongest history Bush reference to recovery recession pushed unemployment to highest level since Great Depression s We mark next week longest peacetime economic expansion our nation s recorded history Bush bragged At midday even as Wall Street being battered by record selling panic Reagan gave glowing account economy s performance at swearing ceremony his new Commerce Secretary William Verity Indeed Labor Department reported earlier month unemployment among American workers fallen to eight year low pct September compared to seven pct year ago Post World War Two peak pct December But interest rates climbing steadily no improvement record U S trade deficit rest world number economic experts expressed doubts staying power current expansion Warnings economic danger around corner been staple Democratic campaign speeches year Democratic party leaders here organizational meeting two weeks ago predicted at time economy be determining factor next year s election The election be decided as most peacetime elections on economic issues Michigan party chairman Richard Weiner In Ohio people uneasy They want to know where economy going added Ohio Democratic leader James Ruvulo American political history replete examples voters throwing out incumbent officeholders when economy turns sour most notably when Democrat Franklin Roosevelt won landslide triumph ended years Republican rule made Democrats nation s majority party more than years But political experts if Monday s stock decline turns out to be temporary phenomena no effect on election Times change conditions change Schneider Quoting legendary baseball manager Casey Stengel Schneider added Never make predictions especially future

text.body: British foreign secretary Sir Geoffrey Howe told his EC colleagues on Monday Britain wants agreement by December on detailed plan to curb EC farm spending if to sanction increase EC budgetary resources British diplomatic sources quoted Howe as saying accord containing detailed figures involving immediate penalties farmers case overproduction must be reached advance EC heads government summit meeting December We require numbers as well as words all commodity regimes Howe quoted as saying EC Commission proposed month plan budgetary stabilisers under there be reductions guaranteed prices restrictions sales into intervention or increases coresponsibility levies if output individual commodities exceeded certain levels Britain so far given clearest backing to idea although several other EC states back outline Diplomats say Britain can exercise some leverage on issue because EC severe budgetary crisis can only emerge if all member states agree to revise system by financed sources quoted Howe as saying An interim or partial solution covering some elements Commission package be unacceptable to United Kingdom They he insisted any penalties imposed on farmers exceeding production limits must take effect same marketing year as overproduction rather than resulting price adjustment following year Howe also there should be no question special fund could top up EC farm coffers event unexpected development such as major fall value dollar Commission suggested such fund to deal emergency situations French EC affairs minister Bernard Bosson told journalists his country could accept idea there should be no emergency reserve The British position become tougher he Howe speaking at meeting EC foreign ministers discussed future EC finances took place simultaneously farm ministers meeting to consider Commission s farm spending proposals Before his meeting got under way British agriculture minister John MacGregor he backed Commission proposal to set cereals production ceiling at tonnes

include trade agriculture services such as banking Yeutter made his remarks at U S Israeli trade meeting marking second year their bilateral accord Canadian U S pact signed by two sides two weeks ago yet been approved by U S Congress Canadian Parliament two free trade agreements FTA gradually remove tariffs other barriers to cross border trade goods many services Yeutter aftermath Canadian Israeli pacts other countries realized if they want to continue to access to world s largest market they better get serious improving GATT pact Israel he gradually increasing shipments both ways Canadian pact substantially increase gross national products both countries Yeutter also Canadian Israeli pacts should serve as important precedents progress GATT Yeutter increasing trade one keys to enhanced political economic stability around globe He a stronger GATT enhance prosperity only advanced industrial nations but also other countries need to increase trade order to better their standards living Yeutter added important to risk progress made Israeli Canadian trade pacts by resorting to protectionism He referring to trade legislation pending Congress force United States to take retaliatory actions against nations large trade surpluses United States if countries practiced unfair trade legislation prompted by growing U S trade deficit hit billion dlrs year still rising Yeutter pressures Congress to act were hard to resist but pending legislation undermine President Reagan s efforts to liberalize world trade Yeutter renewed threat White House veto He President Reagan veto any bill contains serious flaws I believe veto be sustained

text.body: Wall Street s biggest one day drop since revived bitter debate whether modern investment techniques turn shifts investor psychology into colossal moves share prices The market gotten away players Dudley Eppel vice president equity trading at Donaldson Lufkin Jenrette Securities Corp He says stock index futures options distorted investment process But Wall Street professionals who work index futures options insist blame misplaced Fischer Black head trading arbitrage division at Goldman Sachs Co says so called program trading strategies involving opposite positions futures on stock indices underlying stocks deserve almost no blame today s decline People changed their minds future economy he Another strategy known as portfolio insurance may exagerated decline to small degree Black Eli Wachtel Bear Stearns Co emphatic I do believe drop precipitated by portfolio insurance or expanded by program trading The only thing stop end value investor who comes says IBM still sells computers buys traditional reasons Jeffrey Miller Miller Tabak Hirsch Co IBM IBM fell to as Dow Jones Industrial Average dropped more than points Several years ago Miller s firm one first to pursue program trading strategies seeking to lock automatic profit by taking advantage discrepancies prices futures underlying stocks But he his firm been involved since late year Miller some investors who were burned recent market declines may miscalculated effects portfolio insurance He estimated to billion dlrs invested funds prior to decline were hedged futures way portfolio insurance used Miller investors at time they protect their portfolios commit themselves to future course action such as buying put option While negative news such as trade deficits budget deficits build months put options tend to be crowded into narrow span time because they executed as market starts to fall Miller at present people can only guess how much portfolio insurance use He suggested some system disclosure could put other investors on guard seeds were being planted might add to future decline But any case Miller argued index futures options do initiate market trends People like Eppel Donaldson Lufkin Jenrette were steadfast their criticism If I my way there wouldn t be any index futures he They propelled market up when nothing going on now we re paying price Another irate trader referring to IBM s point drop complained what announcement did IBM make over weekend made stock drop points IBM as high as earlier year Some economists agreed stock market could be sending signals economy Allen Sinai chief economist Shearson Lehman Brothers told Reuters point decline represented a crisis confidence This bona fide financial crisis market showing panic I suspect there wholesale deserting our markets by lot foreign investors Sinai crisis caused by continuing U S budget trade deficits by rising interest rates This signal start recession but strong indicator one coming if nothing done Washington to deal budget trade deficits Sinai Some market participants redemptions by investors who own mutual funds fueled decline But Steve Norwitz spokesman T Rowe Price Associates Baltimore based investment management firm redemptions switches into money market funds by Price s one accounts amounted to less than two pct assets It s rout by any means Norwitz company normally receives telephone inquiries reuters.unknown: RM F A f reute u f BC BAKER STOLTENBERG MEE

text.title: BAKER STOLTENBERG MEETING SOOTHES MARKETS
text.author: By Jonathan Lynn and Anthony Williams
text.body: News meeting between U S Treasury Secretary James Baker West German Finance Minister Gerhard Stoltenberg on Monday soothed currency markets allowing dollar to recoup much day s losses dealers News meeting took place Frankfurt great secrecy came after dollar fell sharply on criticism by Baker West German monetary policy provoked fears Louvre pact on currency stability jeopardy dollar reacted immediately to news rising over two pfennigs after hours New York trading dealers there announcement meeting also attended by Bundesbank President Karl Otto Poehl made simultaneously Bonn Washington timed after closure New York markets Baker Stoltenberg Poehl agreed to pursue policies accepted under February Louvre accord finance ministry spokesman Bonn dollar rose to marks New York s close closed there on Friday at marks dollar tumbled nearly three pfennigs as market reacted to Baker s criticism rising West German interest rates stock markets crashed worldwide Baker West Germany apparently breaching Louvre accord Under accord leading industrial democracies pledged to coordinate economic policies to foster currency stability surplus countries West Germany Japan stimulating their economies U S promising to cut budget deficit West German government sources rising West German money market rates could be seen as breach Louvre pact They were rather direct reaction to higher interest rates United States U S Bond yields been rising since May on inflationary fears early September Fed raised discount rate to pct German yields also risen over period but less markedly since late September Bundesbank nudged up short term rates by changing terms on security repurchase pacts principal instrument steering money market allocation rate on facility pct compared pct partly due to West Germany s inability to uncouple itself U S interest rate trends but also reflected concern among monetary conservatives Bundesbank central bank council excessive monetary growth raised fears domestically produced inflation bank economists monetary tightening reflected switch pragmatic line pursued by Bundesbank President Karl Otto Poehl since early year to stabilise mark externally to more cautious approach Vice President Helmut Schlesinger apparent gesture to Baker coinciding his visit Bundesbank repeatedly added money market liquidity morning Dealers clearly move to appease U S anger over most recent West German interest rate rises They the Bundesbank just don t want to come too much under American fire Chris Zwermann currency adviser at Swiss Bank Corp here It seems to me Bundesbank beating quite significant retreat position added Giles Keating economist at Credit Suisse First Boston Ltd London significance retreat emerge terms Bundesbank s next tender securities repurchase pact on Tuesday result on Wednesday money market economists Today s injection liquidity shows Bundesbank does want further strong rise tender allocation rate likely to turn out at between pct little changed pct on facility Bundesbank Finance Ministry given no indication meeting take place although Finance Ministry spokesman been arranged week Earlier on Monday Finance Ministry spokesman asked to comment on apparent U S German clash over Louvre accord went no further than quoting Stoltenberg as saying he assumed monetary cooperation continue spokesman he believed Baker already left West Germany Sweden on Monday week he also due to visit Denmark Belgium

Angeles madly trying to balance their accounts long after close Exchange Chairman Maurice Menn told news conference trading nevertheless begin on time tomorrow at Pacific Daylight Time Menn told reporters price seat on exchange dropped to dlrs today dlrs week ago Menn day also saw options contracts traded compared to record contracts friday Traders both Los Angeles San Francisco volume curbed purely by their inability to fill orders chaos created by exchange tape falling hours behind making nearly impossible to get accurate price readings If we been able to execute orders we got there been shares traded Richard Goforth partner Crowell Weedon Co who trades on Los Angles floor Pacific Exchange Traders San Francisco there were unconfirmed reports one brokerage house alone turned away orders shares they were unable to fill late trading traders exchange officials action on Pacific Exchange did deviate New York some early buying giving way to panic selling through close left Dow Jones Industrial Average down record points We pretty much mirrored what going on New York they couldn t fill their orders we knew we couldn t fill them either Goforth While traders they bracing themselves lower opening tomorrow Mann attributed today s dive to panicking young traders to monetary policy market should still recover It depends on what politicians do There s no reason cannot go back abnormality there no justification People nervous he Mann noted he never seen traders San Francisco leave on floor so long after close Los Angeles one office manager commented early day unusual text.body: New York Stock Exchange chairman John Phelan stock market underwent significant correction today but he did characterize as crash He also NYSE open tomorrow on time The market underwent significant fall significant devaluation assets we all concerned he Speaking to reporters Phelan listed several reasons why market fell today He stocks been going up five years without correction He also blamed inflation fears rising interest rates lower dollar problems Iran All came together very nervous market he It s nearest thing to meltdown I ever want to see Phelan Phelan what he meant by meltdown snowballing effect where selling fed on itself Phelan NYSE going through standard procedures before trading begins tomorrow Those procedures include checking member firms on their liquidity margin positions backlog We know no firm significant problem but could change at any moment he Asked advice average investor Phelan We do know where market end up Dow Jones Industrial average declined record points to Volume record setting shares almost double previous record Phelan response to question on declines foreign markets he believes there no loss confidence global economy He added underlying fundamentals U S economy still strong corporate earnings also continue to be firm Phelan explained today s record descent as being result confluence factors including globalization markets proliferation new securities instruments Those two factors alone made market more volatile he Phelan also major factor decline fact there been no major correction five year bull market He also pointed to rising tension Mideast Gulf New York Stock Exchange constant contact Securities Exchange Commission possible halt all trading on exchange Phelan The consensus better to let market try to work itself out he addition Phelan global nature trading there no guarantee halting trading on New York Stock Exchange served any purpose Phelan he contact Treasury department White House Federal Reserve text.title: YUGOSLAV ECONOMIC PLAN SEEN FACING HURDLES
text.author: By Andrej Gustincic
text.body: Yugoslavia s ambitious economic recovery anti inflation plan faces major hurdles before can be implemented Yugoslav economists Western diplomats Prime Minister Branko Mikulic on Monday proposed new taxes hitting high income earners moonlighters property interest on savings as part new government plans to rein country s pct inflation He also proposed price wage restraint trimming repayments on billion dlr foreign debt line currency earning abiltiy The taxes anger many Yugoslavs struggling soaring prices be resisted Parliament Western diplomatic source Yugoslav economists Mikulic s draft plans left many questions unanswered It list goals concrete measures senior Yugoslav economist at leading Yugoslav research institute state news agency Tanjug more optimistic proposals indicated real economic reforms were coming Further details program Mikulic summarised Parliament to appear days ahead draft to be debated voted on by deputies November The goals good leading Belgrade economist No one can argue But million dollar question as all government programs here how they be implemented Zoran Popov senior research fellow at Belgrade Institute Industrial Economy existing system made many proposals difficult to put into effect A change system taxation requires changes constitution he Mikulic s speech tells us what he wants to do but how It may be anti inflationary one diplomat But question how can you tax black economy how government find out who two jobs or more than one home Economists diplomats proposals could be resisted by deputies several Yugoslavia s constituent republics provinces defence regional interests Such resistance blocked nationwide implementation federal government economic policy on many past occasions
